shapes

Class Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
      • shapes.ArbitrarySimplePolygon
        • shapes.OrientedPolygon
          • shapes.Triangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Rotateable, Translateable, java.io.Serializable

    public class Triangle
extends OrientedPolygon
    A class to represent a polygon with 3 sides. A Triangle can use the area formula base * height / 2 instead of a more general formula like the shoelace formula found in ArbitrarySimplePolygon.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Triangle

        protected Triangle(int x,
                   int y,
                   java.awt.Color color,
                   java.awt.Point[] points,
                   int rotation,
                   int base,
                   int height)
        Constructs a new Triangle with the given coordinates, color, Point array, rotation, base, and height. All Points are copied and translated so that the given coordinates equal the top left corner of the bounding box for the polygon specified in the Point array with the specified rotation. The first and last Points are to be joined by a line segment, in addition to all consecutive elements.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of this Triangle.
        y - The y coordinate of this Triangle.
        color - The Color to draw this Triangle with.
        points - The Points which specify a path that forms a triangle.
        rotation - The amount, in degrees, this Triangle is rotated from its intial orientation. A positive value results in an anticlockwise rotation.
        base - The length of this Triangle's base.
        height - The height of this Triangle.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateArea

        protected double calculateArea()
        Calculates and returns the area of this Shape. It is almost certainly a better idea to use Shape.getArea() instead, as that stores the result so the calculation only occurs once.

        The formula used is base * height / 2.

        Overrides:
        calculateArea in class ArbitrarySimplePolygon
        Returns:
        double, the area of this Shape.
